hypothesis_content.title: Liquidation Cascade Amplification in Stress Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: In a STRESS regime, an initial price decline of -3% within 1 hour that triggers >$150M in long liquidations will be amplified into a further -4% to -7% decline over the next 3 hours, as forced selling from liquidations begets more liquidations, creating a concave price path.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Stress regimes are characterized by high leverage and nervous holders. A sharp drop triggers automatic long liquidations on derivatives exchanges. This forced selling creates additional downward pressure, hitting nearby clustered liquidation levels in a domino effect. The negative funding rate discourages counter-trend longs, allowing the cascade to play out. The move exhausts when major liquidation clusters are cleared.
entry_conditions: Cumulative long liquidations (Coinglass) in that hour > $150M
Estimated Liq Levels (Hyblock/Coinglass) show dense long clusters within -2% to -5% below current price

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price declines an additional -5.5% from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 1-hour candle closes above the high of the entry candle (initial decline reversal)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Median follow-through decline after a -3% drop with >$150M liquidations in Stress regime is ≤ -2.0%, indicating liquidations are absorbed without cascade.
